title: The Coming of the Revolutionary Generation
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Analysis of the American Revolutionary Generation's origins, demonstrating that revolutions are not spontaneous but built across generations of grievance and preparation

revolutionary_generation_concept.legal_usage: Courts refer to 'Revolutionary Generation' when interpreting documents
revolutionary_generation_concept.comparison: Distinct from Reconstructionist, Prohibition, or New Deal Generations
revolutionary_generation_concept.methodology: Courts examine what concepts MEANT to them vs other generations

timeline_misconception.reality: 300 years between Columbus and Revolutionary Generation
timeline_misconception.implication: Revolutions are BUILT, not spontaneous events

great_great_grandfather.name: Lawrence Washington
great_great_grandfather.political_stance: Royalist (supported King vs Parliament in English Civil War)
great_great_grandfather.consequence: Lost position for Treason after Parliament won

inherited_resentment.origin: Family stripped of status by Parliament
inherited_resentment.deeper_cause: Lawrence supported the KING - resentment predated Civil War outcome

george_washington_lineage.dc_flag_significance: Washington DC flag = Washington Family Coat of Arms

post_revolution_kingship.public_desire: Americans wanted Washington as King after Revolution
post_revolution_kingship.why_declined: Did not win alone - shared victory with Jefferson, Franklin
post_revolution_kingship.balance: Royalist family background tempered by Republican co-founders

father.name: Peter Jefferson
father.education: Not formally educated - SELF-EDUCATED through reading
father.achievement: Became Surveyor, mapped previously unmapped territories

maternal_grandfather.name: Isham Randolph
maternal_grandfather.family: Son of William Randolph (close to Peter Jefferson)

randolph_family.power: Made up MOST of British Colonial Government

thomas_jefferson_lineage.jefferson_legacy: Most quotable Revolutionary - extensive written philosophy

benjamin_franklin_lineage.blood: NOT Noble blood, NOT Royalist descendant like Washington
benjamin_franklin_lineage.importance: Arguably MORE important to Revolution than many Revolutionaries

education.formal: Only 2 years of College (father couldn't afford more)

maternal_grandfather.name: Peter Foulger/Folger
roles: Native American language interpreter for Settlers

benjamin_franklin_lineage.birth_year: 1706 - about 70 years old when Revolution started

freemasonry.proof: Letter to Grand Lodge of Massachusetts, Nov 28, 1734
freemasonry.knowledge: Well versed in Freemason mythology (Hiram Abiff, etc.)
freemasonry.modern_access: Lodges in most towns - 'To be one ask one'

john_hancock_lineage.inheritance: Business from Uncle (also Merchant and Smuggler)

revolutionary_philosophy.not_divine: Revolutionary Generation was NOT divinely chosen
revolutionary_philosophy.agency: They CHOSE on their own or were INSPIRED
revolutionary_philosophy.universality: Can happen at any time, anywhere in the world

method.not_voting: Revolution is NOT something you vote for
method.fighting: Something you have to FIGHT for (literally, against oppressors)

patterns_identified.self_education: Jefferson and Franklin both self-taught through reading
patterns_identified.insider_defection: Randolph family = government insiders who turned
patterns_identified.smuggling_class: Hancock represents merchant class opposing trade restrictions
patterns_identified.secret_societies: Franklin's Masonic knowledge informed Revolutionary structure

quiz_questions.q: How long was it between Columbus and the Revolutionary Generation?
quiz_questions.explanation: Revolutions are built over generations, not spontaneous

quiz_questions.q: Why did the Washington family resent Parliament?
quiz_questions.a: Lawrence Washington (great-great-grandfather) lost his Oxford position for being a Royalist
quiz_questions.explanation: Multi-generational grievance preceded the American Revolution

quiz_questions.q: What is significant about Benjamin Franklin's Freemasonry?
quiz_questions.a: He is the ONLY confirmed Founding Father Mason (proven by 1734 letter)
quiz_questions.explanation: His Masonic knowledge informed Revolutionary organizational structure

quiz_questions.q: What did Peter Jefferson and Benjamin Franklin have in common?
quiz_questions.a: Both were self-educated through reading despite limited formal education
quiz_questions.explanation: Self-education was a key trait of Revolutionary lineages

quiz_questions.q: What was John Hancock's family business?
quiz_questions.a: Merchant and Smuggler (inherited from his uncle)
quiz_questions.explanation: Smuggling class opposed British trade restrictions

quiz_questions.q: According to @marsresident, how do revolutions happen?
quiz_questions.a: Not by voting - by fighting for it, literally against oppressors
